intro: Ceropegia dichotoma subsp. krainzii, commonly known as the Krainz's African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically succulent, adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often pale green or yellowish in color. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. This subspecies is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
